page.title: 03THE RAILWAY AT BOROUGH GREEN
page.content: The main development of {Borough Green} was due to the {railway},built in 1874.The {station} was called Wrotham and {Borough Green} because then {Borough Green} was part of Wrotham. The {railway} was built because farmers wanted an easy way to get corn to market at Maidstone. The single track had to go through {Borough Green} because Wrotham was too high up on the North Downs for a {railway}. When the {railway} here opened business men started {to quarry the sand} and ragstone because the {railway} enabled them to transport heavy loads to other places. A second track was laid in 1882 and the {station} name changed to {BOROUGH GREEN} and Wrotham. (by S.Smart,J.Kelso K.Anderson,N.Forrester,D.Sears,all 10 years).
